Module com.example.navalbattle
Package com.example.navalbattle.models

Class PositionTable

java.lang.Object
com.example.navalbattle.models.PositionTable
All Implemented Interfaces:
PositionTableInterface, Serializable
public class PositionTable extends Object implements PositionTableInterface, Serializable
The PositionTable class represents the player's table where all ships are placed. It includes a 10x10 grid, information about the player's ships, and their placement on the board. This class implements the PositionTableInterface interface and can be serialized.

The class manages the placement and checking of ships on the board, and ensures that ships are placed correctly without overlap. It also tracks the state of the board and the remaining ships to be placed.

See Also:
  • PositionTableInterface
  • Serialized Form

    • setShipPosition

      public void setShipPosition(int shipIndex, int row, int col, int orientation)
      Sets the position of a ship on the board based on the given index, row, column, and orientation.
      Specified by:
      setShipPosition in interface PositionTableInterface
      Parameters:
      shipIndex - the index of the ship to be placed.
      row - the starting row where the ship should be placed.
      col - the starting column where the ship should be placed.
      orientation - the orientation of the ship (0 for horizontal, 1 for vertical).

    • checkPosition

      public boolean checkPosition(int shipIndex, int row, int col, int orientation)

      Specified by:

      Parameters:

      row - the row where the ship should be placed.
      col - the column where the ship should be placed.
      orientation - the orientation of the ship (0 for horizontal, 1 for vertical).
      Returns:
      true if the ship can be placed, false otherwise.
